channel.title: CMSC320 Introduction to Data Science
channel.description: Recent content on CMSC320 Introduction to Data Science

item.title: CMSC320 Final Project
item.description: Summary In lieu of a final exam, CMSC320 students will turn in a tutorial that will walk users through the entire data science pipeline: data curation, parsing, and management; exploratory data analysis; hypothesis testing and machine learning to provide analysis; and then the curation of a message or messages covering insights learned during the tutorial. Students may choose an application area and dataset(s) that are of interest to them; please feel free to be creative about this!

item.title: Homework 3: Transformations Exercise
item.description:
An exercise on the effect of transformations on summary statistics.

DUE: Monday April 1st, 11:59pm

item.title: Homework 4: A/B Testing
item.description:
An exercise on statistical inference for A/B testing.

DUE: Tuesday April 16, 11:59pm

item.title: Homework 5: Regression Interpretation
item.description:
An exercise on intepreting regression estimates.

DUE: Friday April 19, 11:59pm

item.title: Homework 2: ER Model and SQL
item.description:
Practice making an ER diagram and writing SQL queries.

DUE: Monday Feb. 25, 11:59pm

item.title: Homework 1: Datatypes and Wrangling
item.description:
In this assignment, you will explore and exercise your knowledge of data types, data operations and data plotting.

DUE: Tuesday Feb. 12, 11:59pm

item.title: Bonus Project: classification
item.description: POSTED: May 1, 2019 LAST UPDATE: May 1, 2019 DUE: May 14, 2019 An experiment on classification. Instructions here Submission Prepare and knit a single Rmarkdown file that includes submission information described above. All axes in plots should be labeled in an informative manner. Your answers to any question that refers to a plot should include both (a) a text description of your plot, and (b) a sentence or two of interpretation as it relates to the question asked.

item.title: Project 3: Regression and Classification
item.description: POSTED: April 18, 2019 LAST UPDATE: May 1, 2019 DUE: May 6, 2019 This project has (now) one part: a. Regression Follow instructions on the linked page to complete your project. Submission Prepare and knit a single Rmarkdown file that includes submission information described above. All axes in plots should be labeled in an informative manner. Your answers to any question that refers to a plot should include both (a) a text description of your plot, and (b) a sentence or two of interpretation as it relates to the question asked.

item.title: CMSC320 Projects
item.description: Data scraping and cleaning Due March 13, 2019 Data wrangling and EDA Due April 5, 2019 Regression Due May 6, 2019 Interactive data visualization and mapping Due May 14, 2019 Bonus Project: Due May 14, 2019 Final Project: Due May 22, 2019 12:30pm

item.title: CMSC320 Resources
item.description: R R is an open-source environment for data analysis. The RStudio IDE is highly recommended. The Revolution IDE is also very good, only Linux and Windows. tidyverse is a collection of data science packages designed for consistency and interoperability. swirl is an interactive R (and general data analysis) tutorial Data Camp has a nice short online course introducing R R Task Views: The Machine Learning and Optimization Task Views list useful packages in R we may use.

item.title: Logistics
item.description: This page constiutes the official syllabus for this class. Course Information Introduction to Data Science CMSC320 Spring 2019 Lecture Meeting Times Tuesday and Thursday, 3:30pm-4:45pm, Instructor: Héctor Corrada Bravo Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department of Computer Science hcorrada@umiacs.umd.edu Office: 3226 Iribe Center for Computer Science and Engineering Phone Number: 301-405-2481 Office Hours: Friday 1:00pm-2:00pm and by appointment Communication: For course related questions, use Piazza as indicated below.

item.title: CMSC320: Introduction to Data Science
item.description: Course Information CMSC320: Introduction to Data Science Spring 2019 Instructor: Héctor Corrada Bravo Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Department of Computer Science hcorrada@umiacs.umd.edu Office: 3226 Iribe Center for Computer Science and Engineering Lecture Meeting Times Tuesday and Thursday 3:30-4:45pm ESJ 0224 Links Check the calendar page for up-to-date course calendar. Check the logistics page for more information, including the official syllabus. Grades and assignments posted in ELMS.

item.title: Data Science Corner
item.description: Lecturely droplets of Data Science interesting stuff…
